DT Article
TI A new and little known species of chrysidid wasps of the genus Chrysis
   (Hymenoptera, Chrysididae) from the Northern Caucasus.
AU Vinokurov, N.B. (niko-vinokurov@yandex.ru) 
SO Zoologicheskii Zhurnal
VL 89
IS 7
PS 885-887
PD Jul 2010
PY 2010
LA Russian
U1 0
U2 2
AB The new species, Chrysis vicana sp. n., and a male of the previously
   unknown Ch. neobule species are described. The basic morphological
   dissimilarities between the new species and the close species, Chrysis
   neobule Sem. are given. Chrysis vicana differs from Ch. neobule in the
   intensively blue coloration of shins, tegulas and the first joint of the
   antenna, well-pronounced and short frontal keel, coloration of the II
   sternite of the belly, brown tarsi, almost black nervation, and closed
   radial nerves of wings. The species Ch. vicana is registered oil
   clay-and-sandy slopes, and the species Ch. neobule on clay-and-sandy
   slopes and in dead woods lathe middle basin of the Kuma River (Stavropol
   region).
C1 Vinokurov, N.B.; Russian Acad Sci, Inst Ecol Mt Terr, Nalchik, Russia,
   Russia.
EM niko-vinokurov@yandex.ru
SC Zoology
SN 0044-5134
BD Systematics; Nomenclature; New taxa; Description; Land zones;
   Palaearctic region; Eurasia
DE Chrysis [Eurasia / Caucasus / Distribution; systematics]. 
   Chrysis vicana [Russia /  / New species]. 
TN Arthropods; Hymenopterans; Insects; Invertebrates
ST Animalia, Arthropoda, Insecta, Hymenoptera, Apocrita, Aculeata,
   Chrysidoidea, Chrysididae
OR Chrysis (Chrysididae).

   Male, p. 885].

TI Eight new species of Empoasca (Hemiptera: Cicadellidae: Typhlocybinae:
   Empoascini) from Peru and Bolivia.
AU Southern, Phillip Sterling (sterling_southern@ncsu.edu)

AB Eight new species in the leafhopper genus Empoasca Walsh 1862 are
   described and illustrated (Empoasca acanthafera n. sp., Empoasca
   affinipeba n. sp., Empoasca apatapeba n. sp., Empoasca daggyi n. sp.,
   Empoasca davidi n. sp., Empoasca nella n. sp., Empoasca peba n. sp.,
   Empoasca pexa n. sp.). Relationships to previously described species are
   discussed. Solanasca Ghauri 1974 is treated as a junior synonym of
   Empoasca (new synonymy) and a revised generic diagnosis is provided.

AB Four species of Acrorrhinium Noualhier of China are recognized, of which
   two, Acrorrhinium amblyangulum and A. dolichantennatum, are described as
   new. A. inexpectatum (Josifov, 1978) is newly recorded from China. The

   the Chinese species is provided. All type specimens are deposited in the
   Institute of Entomology, Nankai University, Tianjin, China.

DT Article
TI The Elachistinae (Lepidoptera: Gelechioidea: Elachistidae) of Ecuador
   with descriptions of five new species.
AU Sruoga, Virginijus (sruogavir@vpu.lt) 
SO Zootaxa
VL 2524
PS 33-50
PD 1 Jul 2010
PY 2010
UR http://www.mapress.com/zootaxa/list/2010/2524.html
AW http://www.mapress.com/zootaxa/2010/1/zt02524p050.pdf
LA English
U1 0
U2 1
AB The occurrence of seven species of Elachistinae is reported from
   Ecuador, including the descriptions of five new species: Elachista
   adunca sp. n., E. laxa sp. n., E. lata sp. n. and E. phiala sp. n. One
   species is documented, but not named pending the availability of
   additional material. The new species are diagnosed and illustrated with
   photographs of the adults and genitalia. Elachista saccharella (Busck)
   is reported for the first time from Ecuador and a new host plant is
   recorded for this species.
C1 Sruoga, Virginijus; Department of Zoology, Vilnius Pedagogical
   University, Studentu Str 39, Vilnius, LT-08106, Lithuania, Lithuania.
EM sruogavir@vpu.lt
OI Sruoga, Virginijus/0000-0002-5687-8299
SC Zoology; Nutrition &Dietetics
SN 1175-5326; 1175-5334
BD Systematics; Nomenclature; New taxa; Nutrition; Diet; Land zones;
   Neotropical region; South America

DT Article
TI A new species of Auyantepuia Gonzalez-Sponga, 1978 (Scorpiones,
   Chactidae) from Suriname.
AU Lourenco, Wilson R. (arachne@mnhn.fr) 
   Duhem, Bernard
SO Entomologische Mitteilungen aus dem Zoologischen Museum Hamburg
VL 15
IS 182
PS 137-145
PD Jun 30 2010
PY 2010
LA English
U1 0
U2 0
AB A new species, Auyantepuia surinamensis sp. n. (Chactidae), is described
   from a savannah-like formation, located in NW Albina, between Albina and
   Moengo in Marowijne, Suriname. The description of the new species
   confirms the pattern of distribution presented by the genus Auyantepuia,
   which is basically confined to the Guiano-Amazon regions. The new
   species represents a first ecological exception, because it was found in
   a savannah-like formation, whereas all other species have been described
   from forested formations.
C1 Lourenco, Wilson R.; Museum Natl Hist Nat, Dept Systemat & Evolut, CP
   053,57 Rue Cuvier, Paris, France, France.
EM arachne@mnhn.fr
SC Zoology
SN 0044-5223
BD Systematics; Nomenclature; New taxa; Diagnosis; Land zones; Neotropical
   region; South America

   139]. 
   Auyantepuia surinamensis (Scorpiones): [Sp nov, Surinam, P. 141].

TI The Compsobuthus species from 'Tassili des Ajjer', Algeria (Scorpiones,
   Buthidae) and description of a new species.
AU Lourenco, Wilson R. (arachne@mnhn.fr) 
SO Entomologische Mitteilungen aus dem Zoologischen Museum Hamburg
VL 15
IS 182
PS 147-155
PD Jun 30 2010
PY 2010
LA English
U1 0
U2 0
AB The Compsobuthus species previously recorded from 'Tassili des Ajjer' in
   the South of Algeria by Vachon (as Compsobuthus berlandi Vachon, 1950),
   is now confirmed as a new species. The description is based on one adult
   male recently collected in the mountains of 'Tassili des Ajjer', and on
   one of the three specimens previously cited from this region by Vachon
   as C. berlandi. The new species is presumably endemic to 'Tassili des
   Ajjer'.

PT J
AN ZOOR14704031653
DT Article
TI A review of the Triassic gastropod genus Kittliconcha Bonarelli, 1927 -
   implications for the phylogeny of Caenogastropoda.
AU Nuetzel, Alexander (a.nuetzel@lrz.uni-muenchen.de) 
SO Zitteliana Reihe A Mitteilungen der Bayerischen Staatssammlung fuer
   Palaeontologie und Geologie
VL 50
PS 9-20
PD 30 Juni 2010
PY 2010
LA English
U1 0
U2 2
AB Eight Triassic species and one variety have been included in the genus
   Kittliconcha BONARELLI, 1927. In this composition, Kittliconcha is
   polyphyletic. The holotypcs of Kittliconcha cassiana BONARELLI, 1927
   (type species of Kittliconcha) and Settsassia obliquecostata (MUNSTER,
   1841) (type species of Settsassia), as well as the type material of
   "Loxonema" walmstedti (KLIPSTEIN, 1843) are studied and illustrated (all
   are from the Cassian Formation). All three species are considered to be
   synonymous here. The former diagnosis of Kittliconcha encompassed the
   presence of a varix and reduction of axial ribs on the last whorl.
   However, these characters resulted from a repaired shell fracture in the
   holotype of Kittliconcha cassiana. This specimen represents actually
   Melania obliquecostata MUNSTER, 1841, which is the type species of
   Settsassia BANDEL, 1992. Therefore, Settsassia BANDEL, 1992 is a synonym
   of Kittliconcha BONARELLI, 1927. Kittliconcha alias its junior synonym
   Settsassia is probably a representative of the cerithimorph stem line as
   is indicated by its small, smooth larval shell which resembles that of
   Campaniloidea. A relationship with Littorinimorpha or other basal
   caenogastropods is also possible. Only a single additional nominate
   Triassic species may actually represent Kittliconcha: K. obesa from the
   Middle Triassic of China. Two species from the Late Triassic of South
   America have been previously assigned to Kittliconcha. They are based on
   poorly preserved and insufficiently documented material so that any
   generic assignment is basically speculative. These species are K
   dissimilis HAAS, 1953, and K. peruviana HAAS, 1953. K doelloi BONARELLI,
   1927 from Argentina is also based on poorly preserved material which is
   of unknown age. The material from the Late Triassic Cassian Formation
   which was assigned to Kittliconcha by ZARDINI (1978) does not belong
   here. It represents the new sinistral genus Triadosinister and two
   species (including one new species) which are tentatively assigned to
   the genus Katosira. These species are Katosira? cortinensis n. sp. and
   Katosira? giauensis ZARDINI, 1978. The holotype of the type species of
   the sinistral genus Allostrophia from the Cassian Formation is
   illustrated. Due to its poor preservation this genus is considered here
   to represent a nomen dubium. The early Triassic species Kittliconcha
   sciaphostera (BATTEN & STOKES, 1986) also does not represent
   Kittliconcha. It is transferred to the genus Pseudotritonium which is
   assigned to the family Maturifusidae. A lectotype of the type species of
   Pseudotritonium (P. venustum from the Cassian Formation) is designated
   and illustrated. The cancellate ornament, shape, aperture, and the
   protoconch morphology of Kittliconcha sciaphostera suggest that this
   species is one of the earliest members of an evolutionary line leading
   to the Mesozoic family Maturifusidae, which could be the stem-group of
   Neogastropoda.
C1 Nuetzel, Alexander; Univ Munich, Bayer Staatssammlung Palaontol and
   Geol, Richard Wagner Str 10, D-80333 Munich, Germany, Germany.
EM a.nuetzel@lrz.uni-muenchen.de
SC Evolutionary Biology; Zoology; Paleontology
SN 1612-412X
BD Systematics; Nomenclature; New taxa; Type species; Type material;
   Diagnosis; Description; Combination; Synonymy; Available name; Taxonomy;
   Taxonomic position; Evolution; Land zones; Palaearctic region; Eurasia;
   Europe; Geological time periods; Mesozoic
DE Caenogastropoda [Phylogeny /  / ]. 
   Katosira? cortinensis [Italy /  / new species] [Triassic /  / ]. 
   Triadosinister [Triassic /  / New genus]. 
TN Invertebrates; Molluscs
ST Animalia, Mollusca, Gastropoda, Prosobranchia, Mesogastropoda,
   Cerithioidea, Epitonioidea, Loxonematoidea
OR Pseudotritonium sciaphosterum - (Batten & Stokes 1986) (Gastropoda):
   [Description, P. 18; Comb nov, Transferred from Kittliconcha, p. 18]. 
   Triadosinister (Gastropoda): [Gen nov, Type species Kittliconcha
   contraria Zardini 1978, p. 15, Triassic; Fossil]. 
   Triadosinister contrarius - (Zardini 1978) (Gastropoda): [Description,
   P. 15; Comb nov, Transferred from Kittliconcha, p. 15; Fossil]. 
   Caenogastropoda (Prosobranchia). 
   Settsassia obliquecostata - (Bronn in Muenster 1841) (Prosobranchia):
   [Referred to, Kittliconcha, p. 12; Fossil]. 
   Melania obliquecostata - Bronn in Muenster 1841 (Cerithioidea):
   [Lectotype designated, P. 12]. 
   Scalaria venusta - Muenster 1841 (Epitonioidea): [Lectotype designated,
   P. 17]. 
   Allostrophia - Kittl 1894 (Loxonematoidea): [Nomen dubium, P. 15;
   Fossil]. 
   Katosira? cortinensis (Loxonematoidea): [Sp nov, Italy, Triassic, P. 16;
   Fossil]. 
   Katosira? giauensis - (Zardini 1978) (Loxonematoidea): [Comb nov,
   Transferred from Kittliconcha, p. 17; Fossil]. 
   Kittliconcha - Bonarelli 1927 (Loxonematoidea): [Emended diagnosis, P.
   14; Syn nov, Settsassia Bandel 1992, p. 12; Taxonomic position, P. 14;
   Fossil]. 
   Kittliconcha cassiana - Bonarelli 1927 (Loxonematoidea): [Redescription,
   P. 12; Fossil]. 
   Kittliconcha contraria - Zardini 1978 (Loxonematoidea): [Designated type
   species for new genus, Triadosinister, p. 15; Lectotype designated, P.
   15; Fossil]. 
   Kittliconcha dissimilis - Haas 1953 (Loxonematoidea): [Taxonomic
   position, P. 17; Fossil]. 
   Kittliconcha doelloi - Bonarelli 1927 (Loxonematoidea): [Nomen dubium,
   P. 17; Fossil]. 
   Kittliconcha giauensis - Zardini 1978 (Loxonematoidea): [Referred to,
   Katosira, p. 17; Fossil]. 
   Kittliconcha obesa - Yu, Pan & Wang 1974 (Loxonematoidea): [Taxonomic
   position, P. 17; Fossil]. 
   Kittliconcha obliquecostata - (Bronn in Muenster 1841) (Loxonematoidea):
   [Redescription, P. 12; Comb nov, Transferred from Settsassia, p. 12;
   Fossil]. 
   Kittliconcha peruviana - Haas 1953 (Loxonematoidea): [Taxonomic
   position, P. 17; Fossil]. 
   Kittliconcha sciaphostera - Batten & Stokes 1986 (Loxonematoidea):
   [Referred to, Pseudotritonium, p. 18; Fossil].

DT Article
TI The Bathysciola ovata (Kiesenwetter, 1850) species complex: designation
   of lectotypes, new synonymy and some taxonomical and chorological
   considerations (Coleoptera, Leiodidae, Cholevinae, Leptodirini).
FT El complejo de Bathysciola ovata (Kiesenwetter, 1850): designacion de
   lectotipos, establecimiento de sinonimias y consideraciones taxonomicas
   y corologicas (Coleoptera, Leiodidae, Cholevinae, Leptodirini).
AU Fresneda, J. (ffresned@gmail.com) 
   Fery, H.
   Faille, A.
SO Boletin de la SEA
VL 46
PS 95-104
PD 30 junio 2010
PY 2010
LA Spanish
U1 0
U2 0
AB A revision of the taxa belonging to the Bathysciola ovata (Kiesenwetter,
   1850) species complex is presented. Bathysciola ovata aragonica
   Coiffait, 1959 and Bath ysciola ovata gabasensis Hustache, 1913 are
   treated as junior subjective synonyms of B. ovata (n. syn.), and the
   rank of the subspecies Bathysciola ovata catalana Coiffait, 1959 is
   changed to species (n. stat.). Thus, from now on this complex includes
   only three taxa, all of specific rank: B. ovata, B. catalana and B.
   minuscula (Abeille de Perrin, 1901). Diagnoses for the three species,
   containing illustrations of the aedeagi and other differentiating
   characters of the external morphology, are given. The species of the
   complex are distributed over the entire Pyrenean massif, on both its
   northern and southern slopes, as well as in the western Alps. The
   distributional data are illustrated by three maps. Lectotypes are
   designated for Bathyscia ovata Kiesenwetter, 1850 and Bathysciola ovata
   gabasensis Hustache, 1913.
C1 Fresneda, J.; Ca de Massa, 25526 Llesp, El Pont de Suert, Lleida, Spain,
   Spain.
EM ffresned@gmail.com
SC Zoology
SN 1134-6094
BD Systematics; Nomenclature; Type material; Synonymy; Taxonomy; Status;
   Land zones; Palaearctic region; Eurasia; Europe
DE Bathysciola catalana; Bathysciola ovata [Spain /  / Distribution]. 
   Bathysciola minuscula [France /  / Distribution]. 
TN Arthropods; Beetles; Insects; Invertebrates
ST Animalia, Arthropoda, Insecta, Coleoptera, Polyphaga, Staphylinoidea,
   Leiodidae
OR Bathysciola (Bathysciola) catalana - Coiffat 1959 (Leiodidae): [Raised
   from, Bathysciola (Bathysciola) ovata catalana, p. 100]. 
   Bathysciola (Bathysciola) ovata - (Kiesenwetter 1850) (Leiodidae): [Syn
   nov, Bathysciola ovata aragonica Coiffait 1959, p. 96; Syn nov,
   Bathysciola ovata var. gabasensis Hustache 1913, p. 96]. 
   Bathysciola (Bathysciola) ovata catalana - Coiffat 1959 (Leiodidae):
   [Raised to, Bathysciola (Bathysciola) catalana, p. 100]. 
   Bathysciola catalana (Leiodidae). 
   Bathysciola minuscula (Leiodidae).

   designated, P. 97].

PT J
AN ZOOR14611081665
DT Article
TI Floian chitinozoans (Lower Ordovician) from Santa Victoria area,
   Cordillera Oriental, northwestern Argentina. systematics.
FT Quitinozoos del Floiano (Ordovicico Inferior) del area de Santa
   Victoria, Cordillera Oriental, noroeste argentino. Sistematica.
AU de la Puente, G. Susana (sdelapuente@mendoza-conicet.gov.ar) 
SO Ameghiniana
VL 47
IS 2
PS 217-238
PD 30 de junio 2010
PY 2010
LA Spanish
U1 0
U2 2
AB Floian chitinozoans from the Acoite Formation outcropping in the La
   Huerta and Grande creeks in the Santa Victoria area, northestern end of
   the Argentinian Cordillera Oriental, in Salta Province are studied. The
   chitinozoans are calibrated according to the previously established
   graptolite zonation in the La Huerta stratigraphic section which
   includes the Tetragraptus akzharensis (latest early Floian),
   "Baltograptus deflexus" (latest middle Floian) and Didymograptellus
   bifidus (late Floian) zones, and the associated acritarch assemblages.
   Despite the fact that species identifications of chitinozoans are
   usually difficult to carry out because of the scarce and poorly
   preserved specimens, a fairly diverse assemblage is observed in the
   studied levels. Seven genera and 15 species are recognized. Of these
   genera, Rhabdochitina, Velatachitina and Siphonochitinn are described
   for the first time in Agentina. Ten species are described for the first
   time in Argentina. Lagenochitina sp. A and Eremochitina sp. A are local
   species exlusively recorded in northwestern Argentina.
C1 de la Puente, G. Susana; CONICET, CCT, Av Adrian Ruiz Leal S-N,Parque
   Gen San Martin, Mendoza, Argentina, Argentina.
EM sdelapuente@mendoza-conicet.gov.ar
SC Paleontology; Zoology
SN 0002-7014; 1851-8044
BD Ecology; Land zones; Neotropical region; South America; Geological time
   periods; Palaeozoic

   / Salta, Santa Victoria / stratigraphical distribution] [Ordovician /
   Lower Ordovician / ].

TI New Hubbardiidae (Arachnida: Schizomida) from Central America.
FT Nuevos Hubbardiidae (Arachnida: Schizomida) de America Central.
AU de Armas, Luis F. (dearmas@ecologia.cu) 
   Viquez, Carlos
SO Boletin de la SEA
VL 46
PS 9-21
PD 30 junio 2010
PY 2010
LA Spanish
U1 0
U2 0
AB Two new genera and six new species of schizomids are described from
   Belize, Guatemala, Honduras and Costa Rica. Data are also given on an
   undescribed species from Honduras, belonging to a possible new genus, of
   which only a female is known. These additions raise to seven the number
   of genera of whip scorpions known from this area. At present, the Costa
   Rican fauna, the best studied in the Central American isthmus, includes
   four genera and 11 species.

DT Article
TI New species and chorological notes of click beetles from the Palearctic
   region, especially from the Middle East (Coleoptera, Elateridae).
AU Platia, Giuseppe (pinoplatia-@tele2.it) 
SO Boletin de la SEA
VL 46
PS 23-49
PD 30 junio 2010
PY 2010
LA English
U1 0
U2 0
AB Thirty-four new species of click beetles belonging to the genera Lacon,
   Agriotes, Elathous, Athous (Orthathous), Dima, Reitterelater,
   Peripontius, Tolphorea, Porthmidius, Melanotus, Cardiophorus,
   Dicronychus and Craspedostethus are described from Israel, Jordan,
   Tadzhikistan, Turkey, Bulgaria, Greece, Lebanon, Croatia, Iran, Syria,
   Iraq and Oman. New chorological records for many species of the genera
   Lanelater, Agrypnus, Lacon, Hemicleus, Heteroderes, Neopristilophus,
   Prosternon, Agriotes, Nothodes, Reitterelater, Mulsanteus, Peripontius,
   Synaptus, Idotarmonides, Isidus, Melanotus, Cardiophorus, Dicronychus,
   Craspedostethus and Plastocerus, and photos of the genitalia or the
   habitus of certain species are published for the first time. A Nearctic
   species, Heteroderes nicholsi Notman, is recorded from Israel.

PT J
AN ZOOR14612084838
DT Article
TI A new genus and species of scorpion (Scorpiones: Vaejovidae) from
   Michoacan, Mexico.
AU Francke, Oscar F. (offb@ibiologia.unam.mx) 
   Ponce-Saavedra, Javier
SO Boletin de la SEA
VL 46
PS 51-57
PD 30 junio 2010
PY 2010
LA English
U1 0
U2 0
AB Kuarapu purhepecha, gen. n., sp. n., from Municipio La Huacana,
   Michoacan, is described from eight adult specimens, four males and four
   females. It appears most closely related to Serradigitus Stahnke (tribe
   Stahnkeini Soleglad & Fet, 2006), sharing the serrated pedipalp finger
   dentition and the placement of trichobothria ib-it near the middle of
   the fixed finger. The characters that separate it from the four genera
   currently recognized in the tribe Stahnkeini are the presence of a
   retrobarbate mating plug in the spermatophore (smooth in other
   Stahnkeini), the presence of sensory pegs on the basal teeth of the
   pectines of females, and five distal spinules ventrally on telotarsus
   III (two on other Stahnkeini). Members of the tribe Syntropini
   Kraepelin, 1905 do not have serrated pedipalp finger dentition, and
   trichobothria ib-it are adjacent to the basal inner denticle.
C1 Francke, Oscar F.; Departamento de Zoologia, Instituto de Biologia,
   Universidad Nacional Autonoma de Mexico, Apartado Postal 70-153, 04510,
   Mexico, D.F., Mexico, Mexico.
EM offb@ibiologia.unam.mx
SC Zoology
SN 1134-6094
BD Systematics; Nomenclature; New taxa; Land zones; Nearctic region; North
   America
DE Kuarapu purhpecha [Mexico /  / New species]. 
TN Arachnids; Arthropods; Chelicerates; Invertebrates
ST Animalia, Arthropoda, Arachnida, Scorpiones
OR Kuarapu (Scorpiones): [Gen nov, Of family Vaejovidae, Type species
   Kuarapu purhpecha, p. 52]. 
   Kuarapu purhpecha (Scorpiones): [Sp nov, Mexico, P. 52].

TI A revision of the genus Parasidis Brethes (Coleoptera, Coccinellidae,
   Microweiseini).
FT Revision del genero Parasidis Brethes (Coleoptera, Coccinellidae,
   Microweiseini).
AU Honour S., Richard
   Gonzalez F., Guillermo
SO Boletin de la SEA
VL 46
PS 59-70
PD 30 junio 2010
PY 2010
LA Spanish
U1 0
U2 0
AB A revision of the genus Parasidis Brethes (Coccinellidae, Microweiseini)
   has led to the description of four new species based on Chilean
   material. The characters of the type species, P. porteri, are defined.
   No changes are made regarding the status of P. australis (Gordon), since
   no new specimens are available. The position of the genus within the
   tribe Microweiseini is ratified.
SC Zoology
SN 1134-6094
BD Systematics; Nomenclature; New taxa; Diagnosis; Description; Taxonomy;
   Key; Land zones; Neotropical region; South America

   gordoni [Chile /  / New species].

   Coccinellidae

DT Article
TI On a new Atelurinae from Principe Island, and new data on the
   Nicoletiidae (Insecta: Zygentoma) of Sao Tome e Principe.
AU Mendes, Luis F. (luis.mendes@iict.pt) 
SO Boletin de la SEA
VL 46
PS 71-76
PD 30 junio 2010
PY 2010
LA English
U1 0
U2 0
AB Samples of Nicoletiidae (Insecta: Zygentoma) from the islands of Sao
   Tome and Principe are studied. The order is recorded for the first time
   from Principe island, from where a new species of a new genus of
   Atelurinae is described. Two other species of the same family are
   recorded from that island, one of them new to the country. Four other
   Atelurinae already known from Sao Tome are again reported from the
   island.

TI The singular morphology of Acledra haematopa (Spinola, 1852) within the
   genus Acledra Signoret, 1864 (Hemiptera: Heteroptera: Pentatomidae), a
   case of Batesian mimicry, with descriptions of a new subgenus.
FT La singular morfologia de Acledra haematopa (Spinola, 1852) dentro del
   genero Acledra Signorte, 1864 (Hemiptera: Heteroptera: Pentatomidae): un
   caso de mimetismo batesiano, con descripcion de un nuevo subgenero.
AU Faundez, Eduardo I. (ed.faundez@gmail.com) 
   Verdejo, Leyla M.
SO Boletin de la SEA
VL 46
PS 77-82
PD 30 junio 2010
PY 2010
LA Spanish
U1 0
U2 1
AB The singular morphology of Acledra haematopa (Spinola, 1852) within the
   genus Acledra is explained as a Batesian mimicry relationship with the
   Asopinae Parajalla sanguineosignata (Spinola, 1852). A new subgenus,
   Neoacledra, subgen. n. is described for A. haematopa.

DT Article
TI A new species of Lasiambia Sabrosky (Diptera, Chloropidae) parasitic on
   mantis oothecae.
AU Nartshuk, E.P. (chlorops@zin.ru) 
   Sanchez, I.
SO Boletin de la SEA
VL 46
PS 83-86
PD 30 junio 2010
PY 2010
LA English
U1 0
U2 0
AB A new species, Lasiambia mantivora Nartshuk, sp. n., reared from the
   oothecae of Mantis religiosa (Linnaeus, 1753) in Spain, is described.
   The new species is compared with Lasiambia baliola Collin and L.
   brevibucca Duda. The adults of L. mantivora were reared from oothecae
   placed on stones. Larvae of fly were found in December feeding on mantis
   larvae, and the adult flies emerged the following spring, before the
   mantis emergence.
C1 Nartshuk, E.P.; Zoological Institute of Russian Academy of Sciences,
   199034, S. Petersburg, Russia, Russia.
EM chlorops@zin.ru
OI Sanchez-Garcia, Inigo/0000-0003-4280-9206

SN 1134-6094

   Eurasia; Europe

   Chloropidae
OR Lasiambia mantivora - Nartshuk 2010 (Chloropidae): [Sp nov, Spain, P.
   84].

DT Article
TI Notes on the genus Cokendolpherius Armas, 2002, with the description of
   a new species from central Cuba (Schizomida: Hubbardiidae).
FT Apuntes sobre el genero Cokendolpherius Armas, 2002, con la descripcion
   de una nueva especie de Cuba central (Schizomida: Hubbardiidae).
AU Teruel, Rolando
   Rodriguez, Tomas M.
SO Boletin de la SEA
VL 46
PS 87-92
PD 30 junio 2010
PY 2010
LA Spanish
U1 0
U2 0
AB A new species of schizomid from central Cuba is described. It represents
   both the second known member of Cokendolpherius Armas, 2002 and its
   first record from Villa Clara province, extending its known distribution
   area by about 135 km to the northwest. Also, the respective diagnosis of
   both this genus and its type-species (Cokendolpherius ramosi Armas,
   2002) are herein redefined, new records are given for the latter, which
   include its first finding outside caves, and its reclassification as a
   troglophilic species is confirmed.
C1 Teruel, Rolando; Centro Oriental de Ecosistemas y Biodiversidad
   (BIOECO), Museo de Historia Natural "Tomas Romay", Jose a Saco # 601,
   esquina a Barnada, Santiago de Cuba 90100, Cuba.

SN 1134-6094

   region; Central America; West Indies

   Cokendolpherius ramosi [Cuba / Sancti Spiritus / New record]. 
TN Arachnids; Arthropods; Chelicerates; Invertebrates
ST Animalia, Arthropoda, Arachnida, Schizomida
OR Cokendolpherius - Armas 2002 (Schizomida): [Emended diagnosis, P. 88].

DT Article
TI Pogonocherus pepa sp. n., a new Baetic-Maghrebian cerambycid
   (Coleoptera: Cerambycidae: Lamiinae).
FT Pogonocherus pepa sp. n., nuevo cerambicido betico-magrebi (Coleoptera:
   Cerambycidae: Lamiinae).
AU Verdugo, Antonio
   Torres-Mendez, Jose Luis
SO Boletin de la SEA
VL 46
PS 109-113
PD 30 junio 2010
PY 2010
LA Spanish
U1 0
U2 0
AB Pogonocherus pepa, sp. n. is described, a new species of Pogonocherus
   Dejean, 1821 with a Baetic-Maghrebian distribution which has been found
   in Los Barrios, Cadiz and the north of Morocco. It can be separated from
   the closest species, Pogonocherus hispidus (Linnaeus, 1758), by the
   lateral spines of the pronotum, which are basally wider and blunter; by
   the shape of apical pit of the terminal sternite of females and, in the
   larval stage, by its three-segmented maxillary palps.
C1 Verdugo, Antonio; Heroes del Baleares, 10, 3o B, 11100 San Francisco
   (Cadiz), Spain, Spain.
SC Zoology; Parasitology
SN 1134-6094

   Hosts; Land zones; Palaearctic region; Eurasia; Europe

   helix (Plant), p. 110; Parasite].

   from Ullung Island (South Korea). Prosternon ullungensis n. sp. is
   described and ten species of the genera Pectocera, Prosternon, Agriotes,
   Ectinus, Elater, Ectamenogonus, Melanotus, Paracardiophorus are recorded

SO Boletin de la SEA
VL 46
PS 127-141
PD 30 junio 2010
PY 2010
LA Spanish
U1 0
U2 0
AB The subgenus Litoboriolus Espanol, 1945 of genus Phylan Dejean, 1821 is
   revised. Phylan mulsanti and P. reyi Piochard de la Brulerie, 1869 are
   valid species erroneously treated as synonyms. The synonymy between
   Phylan mulsanti and P. gadeai Espanol & Vinolas 1981 is confirmed. The
   formerly unknown male of Phylan reyi Piochard de la Brulerie, 1869 stat.
   rest. is redescribed and for the first time figured, giving pertinent
   characters to separe all species. Four new species are described: Phylan
   (Litoboriolus) barclayi n. sp., from Madrid, Guadarrama, Phylan
   (Litoboriolus) bremeri n. sp., from Pontevedra and Salamanca, Phylan
   (Litoboriolus) cobosi n. sp., from Caceres, Extremadura and Phylan
   gloriae n. sp. from the provinces of Caceres, Salamanca, Avila and
   Madrid. The validity of Phylan companyae Vinolas, 1997 versus P.
   collaris (Mulsant & Rey, 1854) is discussed. The subgenera Litororus
   Reitter, 1904 and Litoboriolus Espanol, 1945 are redefined and Phylan
   collaris (Mulsant & Rey, 1854) is recorded from Extremadura for the
   first time. Phylan mulsanti, only known from Extremadura, is excluded
   from other provinces' species lists.
C1 Ferrer, Julio; Department of Entomology, The Swedish Museum of Natural
   History, S-10405 Stockholm, Sweden, Sweden.
EM julio_ferrer@hotmail.com
SC Zoology
SN 1134-6094

   Taxonomy; Key; Land zones; Palaearctic region; Eurasia; Europe

   (Litoboriolus) cobosi; Phylan (Litoboriolus) gloriae [Spain /  / New
   species]. 
   Phylan (Litoboriolus) collaris [Spain / Extremadura / New record].

DT Article
TI Description of Acanthoscurria turumban sp. nov. (Araneae: Theraphosidae)
   and first record of the genus to Venezuela.
FT Descripcion de Acanthoscurria turumban sp. nov. (Araneae: Theraphosidae)
   y primer registro del genero para Venezuela.
AU Rodriguez-Manzanilla, Carlos (aldaroncr@gmail.com) 
   Bertani, Rogerio
SO Boletin de la SEA
VL 46
PS 143-145
PD 30 junio 2010
PY 2010
LA Spanish
U1 0
U2 0
AB Acanthoscurria turumban sp. nov. (Araneae: Theraphosidae) is described
   based on a male from State Bolivar, Venezuela. The new species resembles
   Acanthoscurria antillensis Pocock, 1903 and A. maga Simon, 1892 but can
   be distinguished by morphology of the male palpal organ and tibia I
   apophysis. The genus is recorded for the first time for Venezuela.
C1 Rodriguez-Manzanilla, Carlos; Museo del Instituto de Zoologia Agricola
   Francisco Fernandez Yepez (MIZA), Facultad de Agronomia, Universidad
   Central de Venezuela, Apartado 4579, Maracay 2101, Aragua, Venezuela,
   Venezuela.

   Iberodorcadion (Hispanodorcadion) seguntianum (Daniel & Daniel, 1899),

   (Escalera, 1902) (Coleoptera: Cerambycidae).

   estudio de Iberodorcadion (Hispanodorcadion) seguntianum (Daniel &
   daniel, 1899) y analisis de la posicion sistematica del taxon
   intermedium Escalera, 1902 (Coleoptera: Cerambycidae).

SO Boletin de la SEA
VL 46
PS 235-242
PD 30 junio 2010
PY 2010
LA Spanish
U1 0
U2 0
AB Information is presented on the biology and morphology of lberodorcadion
   (Hispanodorcadion) seguntianum (Daniel & Daniel, 1899), broadening its
   known geographical distribution and analysing the morphological
   differences with the taxon intermedium (Escalera, 1902), for which the
   rank of subspecies is proposed.

PT J
AN ZOOR14612084934
DT Article
TI Auchenorrhyncha (Insecta: Hemiptera) of the Protected Area Mil Cumbres
   (Pinar del Rio, Cuba).
FT Auchenorrhyncha (Insecta: Hemiptera) del Area Protegida Mil Cumbre
   (Pinar del Rio, Cuba).
AU Hidalgo-Gato, Marta M. (hidalgogato@ecologia.cu) 
   Rodriguez-Leon, Rosanna
SO Boletin de la SEA
VL 46
PS 491-497
PD 30 junio 2010
PY 2010
LA Spanish
U1 0
U2 0
AB A study was made of the diversity hemipterans Auchenorrhyncha in the
   Protected Area Mil Cumbres, where is the highest elevation in the
   occidental part of Cuba. Collecting was carried out in 1999 and between
   2001 and 2005. The sweep net mainly, although Malaise traps and light
   collect were used. A total of 5615 specimens were captured, which
   represented 112 taxa, including two new record for Cuba and 39 for the
   protected, 14 of them are Cubans endemics. The families with highest
   numbers of species were Cicadellidae (46 %) and Delphacidae (16 %). The
   more abundant taxa were the leafhoppers Graminella cognita Caldwell,
   1952, Hortensia similis (Walker, 1881), Tylozygus geometricus (Signoret,
   1854), Empoasca sp., Typhlocybella minima Baker, 1903, Chlorotettix
   minimus Baker, 1898; Protalebrella brasiliensis Baker, 1899, Kunzeana
   myersi (Mc Atee, 1926), Joruma sp., Xestocephalus desertorum (Berg,
   1901) and the planthoppers Delphacodes teapae (Fowler, 1905) and
   Delphacodes fulvidorsum (Metcalf, 1923).
C1 Hidalgo-Gato, Marta M.; Instituto de Ecologia y Sistematica, CITMA, A.P.
   8029, C.P. 10 800, La Habana, Cuba, Cuba.
EM hidalgogato@ecologia.cu
SC Zoology; Environmental Sciences &Ecology
SN 1134-6094
BD Ecology; Land zones; Neotropical region; Central America; West Indies
DE Auchenorrhyncha [Community structure /  / New record; records] [Cuba /
   Pinar del Rio, Mil Cumbres Protected area / ]. 
TN Arthropods; Insects; Invertebrates; True Bugs
ST Animalia, Arthropoda, Insecta, Hemiptera, Homoptera
OR Auchenorrhyncha (Homoptera): [New record].

DT Article
TI On the Aderidae of Gibraltar, with notes on the systematics of the
   genera Otolelus Klinger, 2000 and Cobososia Collado & Alonso Zarazaga,
   1996 (Coleoptera).
AU Gompel, Nicolas (gompel@ibdml.univ-mrs.fr) 
   Perez, Charles
   Bensusan, Keith
SO Boletin de la SEA
VL 46
PS 527-531
PD 30 junio 2010
PY 2010
LA English
U1 0
U2 0
AB A provisional list of the Aderidae (Coleoptera) of Gibraltar is
   provided. Four species are recorded, including one new to the Iberian
   fauna: Cobososia angulithorax (Desbrochers des Loges, 1881). The
   systematics of the genera Otolelus Klinger, 2000 and Cobososia Collado &
   Alonso Zarazaga, 1996 is discussed and the following nomenclatural
   change is proposed: Xylophilus benimorae Pic, 1893 = Cobososia
   angulithorax (Desbrochers des Loges, 1881), syn. n.

PT J

DT Article
TI Description of Melanotaenia fasinensis, a new species of rainbowfish
   (Melanotaeniidae) from West Papua, Indonesia with comments on the
   rediscovery of M. ajamaruensis and the endangered status of M. parva.
AU Kadarusman (kadarusman@apsordkp.ac.id) 
   Sudarto
   Paradis, Emmanuel
   Pouyaud, Laurent
SO Cybium
VL 34
IS 2
PS 207-215
PD Jun 30 2010
PY 2010
LA English
U1 0
U2 5
AB A new species of rainbowfish (Melanotaeniidae) is described from the
   Bird's Head Peninsula in West Papua (Indonesia). Melanotaenia fasinensis
   is described from the Fasin River in the vicinity of Ween village, 25 km
   W of Lake Ayamaru. It is distinguished from other melanotaeniids
   occurring on the Peninsula and in the adjacent Raja Ampat Islands by a
   distinct colour, the number of transverse scales, lateral scales,
   predorsal scales, cheek scales and gillrakers, a short head with a lone
   and pointed snout, a narrow interorbital region, relatively small eyes,
   short and slender caudal, long dorsal and anal fins and a moderately
   short predorsal length, and moderately short pectoral and pelvic fins.
   Melanotaenia fasinensis is morphologically similar to M. ajamaruensis, a
   species that has not been seen since it was first captured in 1955
   (Allen, 1990), but rediscovered during our expedition in 2007 near
   Ajamaru Lakes. It seems likely that the upstream portion of the
   Kaliwensi River is the last place where M. ajamaruensis still survives.
   We also highlight the alarming depletion of M. parva, which is endemic
   to Kurumoi Lake. This lake is now nearly dry and contains large numbers
   of exotic tilapia.
C1 Kadarusman; Inst Rech Dev, UR 175, BP 5095,361 Rue J Breton,
   Montpellier, France, France.
EM kadarusman@apsordkp.ac.id
RI Kadarusman, ./B-3057-2012
SC Zoology; Environmental Sciences &Ecology
SN 0399-0974
BD Systematics; Nomenclature; New taxa; Taxonomy; Key; Ecology; Land zones;
   Oriental region; Eurasia; Asia
DE Melanotaenia [Indonesia / Bird's Head & Raja Ampat Islands / Key to
   species]. 
   Melanotaenia ajamaruensis [Indonesia / Kaliwensi River, Soroang / New
   record]. 
   Melanotaenia fasinensis [Indonesia /  / New species]. 
   Melanotaenia parva [Distribution within habitat /  / ] [Indonesia /
   Kurumoi Lake / ]. 
TN Chordates; Fish; Vertebrates
ST Animalia, Chordata, Vertebrata, Pisces, Osteichthyes, Actinopterygii,
   Atheriniformes, Atherinidae
OR Melanotaenia - Gill 1862 (Atherinidae): [Key to species, Indonesia,
   Bird's Head & Raja Ampat Islands, P. 212]. 
   Melanotaenia ajamaruensis (Atherinidae): [New record]. 
   Melanotaenia fasinensis (Atherinidae): [Sp nov, Indonesia, P. 210]. 
   Melanotaenia parva (Atherinidae). 
UT ZOOREC:ZOOR14701003225

DT Article
TI A new species of the genus Hoshihananomia Kono (Coleoptera: Mordellidae)
   from Luzon Is., the Philippines.
AU Kiyoyama, Yoshimi
SO Entomological Review of Japan
VL 65
IS 1
PS 15-19
PD June 30 2010
PY 2010
LA English
U1 0
U2 0
AB A new species, Hoshihananomia okuboi sp. nov., is described from Luzon
   Is., the Philippines. This species is a member of a group consisting of
   H. splendens (MIWA), H. trichopalpis NOMURA and H. masatakai TSURU et
   TAKAKUWA, and closely allied to the last species. Sexual dimorphism is
   noted on the new species and its allies, in which the males exhibit
   peculiar and aberrant sexual modifications in the fore legs.
C1 Kiyoyama, Yoshimi; Abeno-ku, Asahimachi 3-2-5-312, Osaka, 545-0051,
   Japan, Japan.

DT Article
TI Strongylium species (Tenebrionidae: Coleoptera) from Nepal and its
   neighbouring areas.
AU Masumoto, Kimio
   Schawaller, Wolfgang
SO Entomological Review of Japan
VL 65
IS 1
PS 21-40
PD June 30 2010
PY 2010
LA English
U1 0
U2 0
AB The fauna of Strongylium from Nepal and its neighbouring areas is dealt
   with. All known species recorded from these areas are listed with new
   faunal records. Five new species are described: Strongylium martensi sp.
   nov., S. brancuccii sp. nov., S. suridhobanum sp. nov., S. wittmeri sp.
   nov., and S. arunense sp. nov. A new synonym is proposed: Strongylium
   westermanni MAKLIN, 1864 = Strongylium cariosipenne FAIRMAIRE, 1896.
   Altogether, now 18 species of Strongylium are known from Nepal.
C1 Masumoto, Kimio; Institute of Human Culture Studies, Otsuma Women's
   University, Tokyo, 102-8357, Japan, Japan.

   region; Palaearctic region; Eurasia; Asia

DT Article
TI A new species of Agrilus (Coleoptera: Buprestidae: Agrilinae) from
   Honshu, Japan.
AU Fukutomi, Hirokazu (fukutomitama@gmail.com) 
SO Entomological Review of Japan
VL 65
IS 1
PS 59-62
PD June 30 2010
PY 2010
LA English
U1 0
U2 0
AB A new species, Agrilus watanukiorum of the buprestid subfamily
   Agrilinae, is described based on material collected from Carpinus
   cordata BLUME in Niigata Prefecture. Honshu, Japan. This species is
   similar to A. salicivola KUROSAWA known from mainlands Japan, but is
   distinguished from it by absence of prehumeral keel on the pronotum and
   presence of a pair of white maculations on the elytra.
C1 Fukutomi, Hirokazu; Ishikawa Insect Museum, 3, Inu, Yawata-machi,
   Hakusan-shi, Ishikawa, 920-2113, Japan, Japan.

PT J
AN ZOOR14802007824
DT Article
TI Revision of the Platycis genus-group (Coleoptera: Lycidae) from the
   Holarctic region.
AU Matsuda, Kiyoshi
SO Entomological Review of Japan
VL 65
IS 1
PS 75-126
PD June 30 2010
PY 2010
LA English
U1 0
U2 0
AB The Holarctic genera and species of the Platycis genus-group in the
   tribe Erotini are revised, and three genera including two subgenera and
   14 species are recognized. All taxa are redescribed and illustrated
   including new species and new combinations as follows. Four new species,
   Erotides (Glabroplatycis) bocaki sp. nov. from Yunnan, China, E. (G.)
   hayashii sp. nov. from Yakushima Is., Southwest Japan. E. (G.)
   lalashanus sp. nov. and Platycis formosomontanus sp. nov. from North and
   Central Taiwan are herein described. The subgenus Konoplatycis NAKANE,
   1969 of Platycis THOMSON, 1864 is restored to the generic status within
   the tribe Erotini, and the genus Glabroplatycis Pic, 1914 is regarded as
   a sub-genus of Erotides WATERHOUSE, 1879 in this paper. Erotides
   (Glabroplatycis) matsudai (BOCAK, 1996) is newly transferred to the
   genus Konoplatycis by the inspection of the holotype. Erotides
   (Erotides) kanoi (NAKANE) comb. nov. and E. (E.) schneideri
   (KIESENWETTER) comb. nov. are proposed. A key to the genera. subgenera
   and species of the Platycis genus-group herein newly defined is
   provided.
C1 Matsuda, Kiyoshi; 15-27 Hanayashiki, Takarazuka City, Hyogo Prefecture,
   665-0801, Japan, Japan.
SC Zoology
SN 0286-9810
BD Systematics; Nomenclature; New taxa; Description; Combination; Taxonomy;
   Taxonomic position; Status; Key; Land zones; Palaearctic region;
   Eurasia; Asia; China
DE Erotides (Glabroplatycis) bocaki [Yunnan /  / New species]. 
   Erotides (Glabroplatycis) hayashii [Japan /  / New species]. 
   Erotides (Glabroplatycis) lalashanus; Platycis formosomontanus [Taiwan /
    / New species]. 
   Platycis genus group [Land zones / Holarctic / Key to genera; species &
   subgenera] [ /  / Revision]. 
TN Arthropods; Beetles; Insects; Invertebrates
ST Animalia, Arthropoda, Insecta, Coleoptera, Polyphaga, Cantharoidea,
   Lycidae

   78; Comb nov, Transferred from Glabroplatycis, p. 78].

   [Redescription, P. 81; Comb nov, Transferred from Glabroplatycis, p.
   81].

   P. 83].

   Glabroplatycis, p. 75].

   [Redescription, P. 89]. 
   Erotides (Glabroplatycis) hayashii (Lycidae): [Sp nov, Japan, P. 91]. 
   Erotides (Glabroplatycis) lalashanus (Lycidae): [Sp nov, Taiwan, P. 94].
   
   Erotides (Glabroplatycis) matsudai - (Bocak 1996) (Lycidae):
   [Redescription, P. 103; Referred to, Konoplatycis, p. 103].

   [Redescription, P. 98].

   [Redescription, P. 100]. 
   Glabroplatycis - Pic 1914 (Lycidae): [Downgraded to, Erotides
   (Glabroplatycis), p. 75].

   (Erotides), p. 78]. 
   Glabroplatycis schneideri - (Kiesenwetter 1878) (Lycidae): [Referred to,
   Erotides (Erotides), p. 81]. 
   Konoplatycis - Nakane 1969 (Lycidae): [Raised from, Platycis
   (Konoplatycis), p. 75]. 
   Konoplatycis matsudai - (Bocak 1996) (Lycidae): [Comb nov, Transferred
   from Erotides (Glabroplatycis), p. 103]. 
   Konoplatycis otome - (Kono 1932) (Lycidae): [Redescription, P. 105]. 
   Platycis (Konoplatycis) - Nakane 1969 (Lycidae): [Raised to,
   Konoplatycis, p. 75]. 
   Platycis consobrinus - (Bourgeois 1902) (Lycidae): [Redescription, P.
   109; Combination revalidated, Previous combination not given, p. 109]. 
   Platycis formosomontanus (Lycidae): [Sp nov, Taiwan, P. 112]. 
   Platycis genus group (Lycidae): [Taxon nov, New genus group, p. 119; Key
   to genera, Holarctic, P. 117; Key to subgenera, Holarctic, P. 117; Key
   to species, Holarctic, P. 117]. 
   Platycis minutus - (Fabricius 1787) (Lycidae): [Redescription, P. 114].

DT Article
TI A new subgenus and species of Mylabris Fabricius (Coleoptera: Meloidae)
   from China.
AU Pan, Zhao
   Wang, Xin-pu
   Ren, Guo-dong (gdren@hbu.edu.cn) 
SO Entomological Review of Japan
VL 65
IS 1
PS 191-197
PD June 30 2010
PY 2010
LA English
U1 0
U2 0
AB Spinabris subgen. nov. is proposed upon Mylabris (Spinabris)
   spinungulata sp. nov. as the types species from Xinjiang. China. The
   main character of the new subgenus is the claws bearing spiniform
   ventral blade. The morphological structures of the new species are
   illustrated. and adult photographs are provided. The morphology of claw
   of postpedes and empodia of mesopedes were observed with a Scanning
   Electron Microscope. Type specimens are deposited in the Hebei
   University Museum, Baoding, China.
C1 Ren, Guo-dong; College of Life Sciences, Hebei University, Baoding,
   Hebei, 071002, Japan, Japan.
EM gdren@hbu.edu.cn

   zones; Palaearctic region; Eurasia; Asia; China

PT J
AN ZOOR14611081167
DT Article
TI The genus Eustala (Araneae, Araneidae) in southern Brazil: two new
   species, complementary descriptions and new records.
FT O genero Eustala (Araneae, Araneidae) no sul do Brasil: duas especies
   novas, descricoes complementares e novas ocorrencias.
AU Poeta, Maria Rita M. (maria.poeta@acad.pucrs.br) 
   Marques, Maria Aparecida L.
   Buckup, Erica Helena
SO Iheringia Serie Zoologia
VL 100
IS 2
PS 151-161
PD 30 de junho 2010
PY 2010
LA Portuguese
U1 0
U2 1
AB The genus Eustala (Araneae, Araneidae) in southern Brazil: two new
   species, complementary descriptions and new records. Eustala levii sp.
   nov. and E. palmares sp. nov. are described from Rio Grande do Sul,
   Brazil, based on both sexes. The males of E. albiventer (Keyserling,
   1884), E. taquara (Keyserling, 1892), and E. photographica Mello-Leitao,
   1944 are described for the first time and the females are redescribed.
   Eustala sanguinosa (Keyserling, 1893) is synonymized with E. albiventer.
   Additionally, E. photographica, described from Argentina, is newly
   recorded from Brazil. New records are provided for E. minuscula
   (Keyserling, 1892) and E. saga (Keyserling, 1893).
C1 Poeta, Maria Rita M.; Fundacao Zoobot Rio Grande Sul, Museu Ciencias
   Nat, Rua Dr Salvador Franca 1427, Porto Alegre, RS, Brazil, Brazil.
EM maria.poeta@acad.pucrs.br
SC Zoology
SN 0073-4721
BD Systematics; Nomenclature; New taxa; Description; Synonymy; Land zones;
   Neotropical region; South America
DE Eustala [Brazil / South / Distribution; systematics]. 
   Eustala levii; Eustala palmares [Brazil /  / New species]. 
   Eustala minuscula; Eustala photographica; Eustala saga [Brazil /  / New
   record]. 
TN Arachnids; Arthropods; Chelicerates; Invertebrates
ST Animalia, Arthropoda, Arachnida, Araneae
OR Eustala (Araneae). 
   Eustala albiventer - (Keyserling 1884) (Araneae): [First time described,

   Hokkaido is described for the first time. Two new species of the

   names C. (M.) ryukyuense sp. nov. and C. (M.) rubellum sp. nov. A key to
   Ryukyuan species of the subfamily Coloninae is given. As a result of
   this study, the number of Japanese species of Coloninae becomes fifteen.

TI The First Discovery of the Genus Tossinola from Japan, with Description
   of A New Species (Hymenoptera, Ichneumonidae, Banchinae).
AU Watanabe, Kyohei
   Ishikawa, Tadashi
   Konishi, Kazuhiko
SO Japanese Journal of Systematic Entomology
VL 16
IS 1
PS 25-31
PD June 30 2010
PY 2010
LA English
U1 0
U2 0
AB The genus Tossinola is recorded for the first time from Japan, with 71
   ryukyuensis sp. nov. described here on the basis of specimens from
   Tokuno-shima Island and Okinawa-jima Island, the Ryukyus. This new
   species can easily be distinguished from other species of the genus by
   the following features: mesoscutum with a large reddish spot,
   rnesopleuron with two reddish spots, First metasomal tergite with
   moderately coarse punctures, heptagonal male subgenital plate and
   relatively short ovipositor.
SC Zoology
SN 1341-1160

   Palaearctic region; Eurasia; Asia

   include new species, p. 31; New record].

DT Article
TI The Army Ant Aenictus wroughtonii (Hymenoptera, Formicidae, Aenictinae)
   and Related Species in the Oriental Region, with Descriptions of Two New
   Species.
AU Jaitrong, Weeyawat
   Yamane, Seiki
   Wiwatwitaya, Decha
SO Japanese Journal of Systematic Entomology
VL 16
IS 1
PS 33-46
PD June 30 2010
PY 2010
LA English
U1 0
U2 2
AB The Aenictus wroughtonii species group is established to include seven
   species (five named and two new species) occurring in the Oriental and
   Indo-Australian regions: A. artipus WILSON, A. biroi FOREL, A. camposi
   WHEELER et CHAPMAN, A. sagei FOREL, A. stenocephalus JAITRONG et YAMANE,
   sp. nov., A. vieti JAITRONG et YAMANE, sp. nov. and A. wroughtonii
   FOREL. Three species are restricted to western part of the Oriental
   region, i.e, India and Sri Lanka (A. biroi, A. sagei and A.
   wroughtonii), and four are mainly distributed in Southeast Asia (A.
   artipus, A. camposi, A. stenocephalus sp. nov. and A. vieii sp. nov.).
   A. artipus is new to Vietnam, and A. camposi is new to Sumatra. Among
   food source of this species group are small ants of the subfamily
   Formicinae such as Paratrechina, Prenolepis and Plagiolepis.
SC Zoology
SN 1341-1160

   Taxonomy; Key; Land zones; Oriental region; Palaearctic region; Eurasia;
   Asia

   distribution; systematics].

   36; New record].

   designated, P. 38; Redescription, Worker, p. 38; New record].

   41].

DT Article
TI The Scutacarid Mites of Japan. XV. Archidispus palcuapi, A New Species
   Phoretic on Acupalpus (Palcuapus) inornatus BATES (Coleoptera,
   Carabidae).
AU Kurosa, Kazuyoshi (CQW35713@nifty.com) 
SO Japanese Journal of Systematic Entomology
VL 16
IS 1
PS 71-75
PD June 30 2010
PY 2010
LA English
U1 0
U2 0
AB A new species of scutacarid mites, Archidispus palcuapi, is described
   from Japan on the basis of the phoretic females found on the cervical
   membrane between head and prothorax of the carabid beetle, Acupalpus
   (Palcuapus) inornatus BATES. This new species is readily distinguished
   from all the known congeners by the following characteristics: cupules
   ia and ip are close to opisthosomal dorsal setae d and h2, respectively;
   coxal setae 1a, 2a, 4a, 4b and 4c are exceedingly modified; coxal setae
   4a and 4b are inserted close by apodemes 4 and the posterior margin of
   coxisternal plates IV, respectively.
C1 Kurosa, Kazuyoshi; Nishi Ikebukuro 5-21-15, Tokyo, Japan, Japan.
EM CQW35713@nifty.com
SC Zoology; Environmental Sciences &Ecology
SN 1341-1160
BD Systematics; Nomenclature; New taxa; Associations; Commensalism; Land
   zones; Palaearctic region; Eurasia; Asia
DE Acupalpus (Palcuapus) inornatus [Phoresy / Archidispus palcuapi
   (Arachnida) / New phoretic species] [Japan /  / New arachnid phoretic
   species]. 
   Archidispus palcuapi [Phoresy / Acupalpus (Palcuapus) inornatus
   (Coleoptera) / New phoretic species] [Japan /  / New species from
   coleopteran phoretic host]. 
TN Arachnids; Arthropods; Beetles; Chelicerates; Insects; Invertebrates
ST Animalia, Arthropoda, Arachnida, Acari, Insecta, Coleoptera, Adephaga,
   Caraboidea, Carabidae
OR Archidispus palcuapi (Acari): [Sp nov, Japan, Phoretic on Acupalpus
   (Palcuapus) inornatus (Coleoptera), p. 71]. 
   Acupalpus (Palcuapus) inornatus (Carabidae).

TI A Revision of the pseudolictrius Species Group of the Genus Asiopodabrus
   (Coleoptera, Cantharidae).
AU Takahashi, Kazuhiro
   Imasaka, Shoichi
SO Japanese Journal of Systematic Entomology
VL 16
IS 1
PS 123-160
PD June 30 2010
PY 2010
LA English
U1 0
U2 0
AB The pseudolictrius species group of the genus Asiopodabrus is revised.
   Fourteen species and a subspecies are recognized. Of these, twelve new
   species and a new subspecies are described as Asiopodabrus daisenensis
   IMASAKA et TAKAHASHI, sp. nov., A. ehimensis TAKAHASHI, sp. nov., A.
   hatayamai TAKAHASHI et IMASAKA, sp. nov., A. hibaensis IMASAKA et
   TAKAHASHI, sp. nov., A. kamegamoriensis TAKAHASHI et IMASAKA, sp. nov.,
   A. kotsuzanus TAKAHASHI et IMASAKA, sp. nov., A. nakaharai TAKAHASHI et
   IMASAKA, sp. nov., A. ohtsukai TAKAHASHI et IMASAKA, sp. nov., A.
   okayamaensis IMASAKA et TAKAHASHI, Sp. nov., A. ryokoae IMASAKA, sp.
   nov., A. ryokoae sefurisanus IMASAKA et TAKAHASHI, ssp. nov., A.
   tokaiensis IMASAKA et TAKAHASHI, sp. nov. and A. yamaguchiensis IMASAKA
   et TAKAHASHI, sp. nov. Two hitherto known species are redescribed. A key
   to the species is given in the text. Habitus and male genitalia of all
   the species are illustrated. Three lineages are recognized in the
   species group based on a phylogenetic analysis.

   Evolution; Zoogeography; Land zones; Palaearctic region; Eurasia; Asia

   tokaiensis; Asiopodabrus yamaguchiensis [Japan /  / New species].

TI Anomiid bivalves from the Lower Miocene of Kolasib, Mizoram.
AU Mazumder, Baharul Islam (bimazumder@rediffmail.com) 
SO Journal of the Palaeontological Society of India
VL 55
IS 1
PS 45-49
PD Jun 30 2010
PY 2010
LA English
U1 0
U2 0
AB A small collection of Anomiidae (two new species of Anomia and one
   species of Placuna) is described from a thin Calcareous Sandstone bed
   exposed at Quarry Veng of Kolasib in Mizoram. The bed is of the Upper
   Bhuban Formation of the Surma Group. Biostratigraphically, it falls in
   the Zonule IIA(b): Conus (Dendroconus) loroisii - Archimediella
   (Torculoidella) angulata Zonule, and is assigned to the Burdigalian.
C1 Mazumder, Baharul Islam; Karimganj Coll, Dept Geol, Karimganj, Assam,
   India, India.
EM bimazumder@rediffmail.com

   Tertiary; Neogene

PT J
AN ZOOR14611080404
DT Article
TI Two new genera and species of aphaenopsoid cave-dwelling Trechini
   beetles from Croatia and Montenegro (Coleoptera: Carabidae: Trechinae).
AU Lohaj, Roman (rlohaj@gmail.com) 
   Lakota, Jan
SO Natura Croatica
VL 19
IS 1
PS 77-97
PD June 30 2010
PY 2010
LA English
U1 0
U2 1
AB Two new genera of cave-dwelling aphaenopsoid Trechini beetles,
   Jalzicaphaenops gen. nov. poljaki sp. nov. from Dumencica spilja (cave)
   near Rakovica (central Croatia) and Acheroniotes gen. nov. mlejneki sp.
   nov. from pits on Prekornica mountain range (central Montenegro) are
   described and illustrated. Both new genera are characterized by the
   presence of posterior pronotal setae, Jalzicaphaenops gen. nov. also by
   the presence of a pair of setae on pronotal disc. The key to the
   identification of all hitherto known aphaenopsoid Trechini genera from
   Dinarids is given. Data on the distribution and ecology of these
   remarkable genera, complemented with descriptions of the type localities
   are also provided.
C1 Lohaj, Roman; Institute of Forensic Sciences, Kuzmanyho 8, SK-041 02
   Kosice, Slovakia, Slovakia.
EM rlohaj@gmail.com
SC Zoology
SN 1330-0520
BD Systematics; Nomenclature; New taxa; Taxonomy; Key; Land zones;
   Palaearctic region; Eurasia; Europe
DE Acheroniotes mlejneki [Montenegro /  / New species]. 
   Jalzicaphaenops poljaki [Croatia /  / New species]. 
   Trechini [Croatia / Dinaric Alps / Key to genera] [ /  / Distribution;
   systematics] [Montenegro /  / ]. 
TN Arthropods; Beetles; Insects; Invertebrates
ST Animalia, Arthropoda, Insecta, Coleoptera, Adephaga, Caraboidea,
   Carabidae
OR Acheroniotes (Carabidae): [Gen nov, Of tribe Trechini, Type species
   Acheroniotes mlejneki, p. 86]. 
   Acheroniotes mlejneki (Carabidae): [Sp nov, Montenegro, P. 87]. 
   Jalzicaphaenops (Carabidae): [Gen nov, Of tribe Trechini, Type species
   Jalzicaphaenops poljaki, p. 80]. 
   Jalzicaphaenops poljaki (Carabidae): [Sp nov, Croatia, P. 81]. 
   Trechini (Carabidae): [Key to genera, Croatia, Dinaric Alps, P. 94]. 
UT ZOOREC:ZOOR14611080404

DT Article
TI Taxonomical and ecological notes on the genus Scotoplanetes Absolon,
   with the description of a new species from Montenegro (Coleoptera:
   Carabidae: Trechini).
AU Lakota, Jan
   Lohaj, Roman (roman.lohaj@minv.sk) 
   Dunay, Gejza
SO Natura Croatica
VL 19
IS 1
PS 99-110
PD June 30 2010
PY 2010
LA English
U1 0
U2 0
AB Scotoplanetes aquacultor n. sp. from the "Vodna jama" pit (Dragaljsko
   polje near Grahovo, southwest Montenegro), second known species of the
   genus is described, illustrated and compared with the congeneric species
   Scotoplanetes arenstorffianus Absolon, 1913. Based on the examination of
   the holotype, Scotoplanetes arenstorffianus weiratherianus Noesske, 1928
   is reconsidered in synonymy to Scotoplanetes arenstorffianus. Data about
   the taxonomy of this remarkable genus, complemented with the description
   of habitat and the bionomy are given.
C1 Lohaj, Roman; Institute of Forensic Sciences, Kuzmanyho 8, SK-041 02
   Kosice, Slovakia, Slovakia.
EM roman.lohaj@minv.sk
SC Environmental Sciences &Ecology; Zoology
SN 1330-0520

   Subterranean habitat; Land zones; Palaearctic region; Eurasia; Europe
DE Scotoplanetes [Cave habitat /  / Biology; distribution; systematics]
   [Montenegro /  / ]. 
   Scotoplanetes aquacultor [Montenegro /  / New species]. 
TN Arthropods; Beetles; Insects; Invertebrates
ST Animalia, Arthropoda, Insecta, Coleoptera, Adephaga, Caraboidea,
   Carabidae
OR Scotoplanetes (Carabidae). 
   Scotoplanetes aquacultor (Carabidae): [Sp nov, Montenegro, P. 104]. 
   Scotoplanetes arenstroffianus - Absolon 1913 (Carabidae): [Diagnostic
   characters, P. 108; Syn nov, Scotoplanetes arenstroffianus
   weiratherianus Noesske 1928, p. 101].

DT Article
TI Taxonomic revision of Physocyclus Simon, 1893 (Araneae: Pholcidae), with
   the description of new species from Mexico.
FT Revision taxonomica de Physocyclus Simon, 1893 (Araneae: Pholcidae), con
   la descripcion de especies nuevas de Mexico.
AU Valdez-Mondragon, Alejandro (lat_mactans@yahoo.com.mx) 
SO Revista Iberica de Aracnologia
VL 18
PS 3-80
PD 30 Junio 2008(2010)
PY 2010
LA Spanish
U1 0
U2 0
AB The taxonomic revision of Physocyclus Simon, 1893 is presented. Twelve
   species with incomplete descriptions are redescribed and taxonomic
   information completed. New distribution records for the majority of the
   species are provided. The male of Physocyclus lautus Gertsch, 1971, is
   described for the first time. Thirteen new species are described:
   Physocyclus franckei sp. nov., Physocyclus michoacanus sp. nov.,
   Physocyclus brevicornus sp. nov., Physocyclus gertschi sp. nov.,
   Physocyclus huacana sp. nov., Physocyclus montanoi sp. nov., Physocyclus
   marialuisae sp. nov., Physocyclus sprousei sp. nov., Physocyclus darwini
   sp. nov., Physocyclus rothi sp. nov., Physocyclus sarae sp. nov.,
   Physocyclus platnicki sp. nov. and Physocyclus paredesi sp. nov.
   Taxonomic keys for identification of males and females of Physocyclus
   species are presented.

   Departamento de Zoologia, Instituto de Biologia, Universidad Nacional
   Autenoma de Mexico (UNAM), Tercer circuito exterior s/n, Apartado postal

   Federal, Mexico, Mexico.

PT J
AN ZOOR14611080161
DT Article
TI Cyriocosmus venezuelensis sp. n. from Venezuela (Araneae: Theraphosidae:
   Theraphosinae).
AU Kaderka, Radan (radan.kaderka@seznam.cz) 
SO Revista Iberica de Aracnologia
VL 18
PS 87-96
PD 30 Junio 2008(2010)
PY 2010
LA English
U1 0
U2 0
AB Cyriocosmus venezuelensis sp. n. from Venezuela, State of Lara and
   Carabobo, is described, diagnosed and keyed. The new species can be
   distinguished from all other congeners by its uniformly coloured
   carapace, dark ventral band on the abdomen and by the paraembolic
   apophysis in male palpal bulb being half the length of the embolus.
   Cyriocosmus rogerioi Perez-Miles & Weinmann, 2009 is placed in the
   synonymy of C. pribiki Perez-Miles & Weinmann, 2009, from which it does
   not differ in any characters of specific significance.
C1 Kaderka, Radan; Tyrsovo namesti 1732, 252 63 Rortoky u Prahy, Czech
   Republic, Czech Republic.
EM radan.kaderka@seznam.cz
SC Zoology
SN 1576-9518

   Land zones; Neotropical region; South America

TI Amblysiphonella agahensis nov. sp., and Musandamia omanica nov. gen.,
   nov. sp. (Porifera) from the Upper Triassic of Oman.
AU Senowbari-Daryan, Baba (basendar@pal.uni-erlangen.de) 
   Bernecker, Michaela
SO Zitteliana Reihe A Mitteilungen der Bayerischen Staatssammlung fuer
   Palaeontologie und Geologie
VL 50
PS 3-7
PD 30 Juni 2010
PY 2010
LA English
U1 0
U2 0
AB Two chambered sponges - A. agahensis nov. sp. and Musandamia omanica
   nov. gen., nov. sp. - from the Norian reefal limestones of Jebel Agah,
   southeast of the Musandam Mountains, Oman, are described. Both species
   are the first reported from the Triassic of the Arabian Peninsula. The
   fossil association is also mentioned.

DT Article
TI Rare Middle Jurassic ammonites of the families Erycitidae, Otoitidae and
   Stephanoceratidae from southern Germany.
AU Dietze, Volker (v.dietze@enmail.de) 
   Schweigert, Guenter
   Dietl, Gerd
   Auer, Wolfgang
   Dangelmaier, Wolfgang
   Furze, Roger
   Graebenstein, Stefan
   Kutz, Michael
   Neisser, Elmar
   Schneider, Erich
   Schreiber, Dietmar
SO Zitteliana Reihe A Mitteilungen der Bayerischen Staatssammlung fuer
   Palaeontologie und Geologie
VL 50
PS 71-88
PD 30 Juni 2010
PY 2010
LA English
U1 0
U2 0
AB We present insufficiently or previously unknown ammonites of the
   families Erycitidae SPATH, 1928, Otoitidae MASCKE, 1907 and
   Stephanoceratidae NEUMAYR, 1875 from the Upper Aalenian and early Lower
   Bajocian (Middle Jurassic) of southern Germany. The newly recorded taxa
   of the Erycitidae are: Abbasites gardincola (DE GREGORIO), Abbasites
   aff. abbas BUCKMAN and Spinammatoceras aff. sagax (VACEK); of the
   Otoitidae: Docidoceras zemistephanoides GECZY, D. cf. wysogorskii
   (PRINZ), Docidoceras sp., Parsemileites liebi (MAUBEUGE), Otoites
   tumulosus WESTERMANN, O. douvillei PARSONS, Emileia contrahens BUCKMAN
   and E. dundriensis CALLOMON & CHANDLER, and a new species, Docidoceras
   chandleri DIETZE, DIET!,. & SCHWEIGERT. The latter taxon is also
   recorded from southern England. The stephanoceratid genus Mollistephanus
   is recorded for the first time from southern Germany by a single
   specimen of M. aff. kondai GALACZ.

DT Article
TI Eriophyoidea of China: a review of progress, with a checklist.
AU Hong, Xiao-Yue (xyhong@njau.edu.cn) 
   Xue, Xiao-Feng
   Song, Zi-Wei
SO Zoosymposia
VL 4
PS 59-93
PD 30 June 2010
PY 2010
LA English
U1 0
U2 0
AB This paper reviews the taxonomic research on the superfamily
   Eriophyoidea in China, with an updated checklist of 932 species
   belonging to 3 families, 10 subfamilies, 15 tribes and 187 genera,
   including a new name and a new combination: Cosella yangmingshanis nom.
   nov. and Aceria celtis (Huang, 2001) comb. nov., respectively. Hai- Yuan
   Kuang and his co-authors described 244 new species, Xiao-Yue Hong and
   his co-authors described 232 new species, Sui-Gai Wei and his co-authors
   described 122 new species, Jie-Liu Xin and his colleagues added 13 new
   species, Kun-Wei Huang and his colleagues described 229 new species from
   Taiwan, Tsan Huang, and his coauthors added 10 new species from Taiwan.
   Reports on the biology and control of the Eriophyoidea are relatively
   few in China, and these are briefly reviewed.
C1 Hong, Xiao-Yue; Department of Entomology, Nanjing Agricultural
   University, Nanjing, Jiangsu 210095, China, China.
EM xyhong@njau.edu.cn

   Taxonomic position; Animals and man; Documentation; Publications;
   Parasites diseases and disorders; Hosts; Land zones; Palaearctic region;
   Eurasia; Asia

   / ] [Literature review /  / ] [Plant hosts /  / ] [China /  / biology].

TI A review of progress in taxonomy of water mites from China (Acari:
   Hydrachnidia).
AU Jin, Dao-Chao
   Yi, Tian-Ci
   Guo, Jian-jun
SO Zoosymposia
VL 4
PS 106-119
PD 30 June 2010
PY 2010
LA English
U1 0
U2 1
AB With a brief review on taxonomic studies of Chinese water mites since
   the early 20th century, this paper gives a checklist of the 193 species
   in 34 subgenera, 36 genera, 19 subfamilies, 19 families, 7
   superfamilies, recorded from China. Forty-five of these species (23.38%)
   are Palaearctic-Oriental or polyregional, 19 (9.9%) Palaearctic, 129
   (66.8%) Oriental, and 118 (61.1%) known at present only from China. The
   information on distribution within China is given for each species.
   Hygrobates (Rivobates) octoporus Jin, 1996 is replaced with Hygrobates
   (Rivobates) hexoporus Jin & Yi nomen novum.
C1 Jin, Dao-Chao; Institute of Entomology, Guizhou University, the
   Provincial Key Laboratory for Agricultural Pest Management of
   Mountainous Region Guiyang 550025, China, China.

DT Article
TI Oribatid mites of China: a review of progress, with a checklist.
AU Chen, Jun (chenj@ioz.ac.cn) 
   Liu, Dong
   Wang, Hui-Fu
SO Zoosymposia
VL 4
PS 186-224
PD 30 June 2010
PY 2010
LA English
U1 0
U2 2
AB The present paper gives a review of the taxonomic study on the suborder
   Oribatida (the cohort Astigmata excepted) in China including Hong Kong
   and Taiwan, with a checklist of 599 species and subspecies in 275
   genera, representing 97 families. One junior synonymes is proposed,
   i.e., Peloribates praeoccupatus Subas, 2004 is regarded as a junior
   synonym of Peloribates tsengi Wen, Wang & Chen, 2003. The taxonomic
   study of oribatid mites in China was started by A. P. Jacot in 1922, and
   was very productive during the period from 1980 to the end of last
   century with the efforts of several Chinese and foreign oribatologists.
   In addition to taxonomic research, publications on biodiversity,
   seasonal dynamics, biological monitoring for soil pollution, and
   esterase isoenzyme patterns of oribatid mites have been published by
   Chinese scholars.
C1 Chen, Jun; Key Laboratory of Zoological Systematics and Evolution,
   Institute of Zoology, Chinese Academy of Sciences, Beijing 100101,
   China, China.
EM chenj@ioz.ac.cn
RI Liu, Dong/N-3419-2015
OI Liu, Dong/0000-0001-5009-2466
SC Zoology
SN 1178-9905
BD Systematics; Nomenclature; Synonymy; Documentation; Publications; Land
   zones; Palaearctic region; Eurasia; Asia
DE Oribatida [Checklists / Distributional checklist / Systematics]
   [Literature review /  / ] [China /  / Biology]. 
TN Arachnids; Arthropods; Chelicerates; Invertebrates
ST Animalia, Arthropoda, Arachnida, Acari
OR Oribatida (Acari).

DT Article
TI The lanternfly genus Penthicodes: key to the species and review of the
   "Ereosoma group" with two new species and one new subspecies (Hemiptera:
   Fulgoromorpha: Fulgoridae).
AU Constant, Jerome (entomo@naturalsciences.be) 
SO Zootaxa
VL 2523
PS 1-26
PD 30 Jun 2010
PY 2010
UR http://www.mapress.com/zootaxa/list/2010/2523.html
AW http://www.mapress.com/zootaxa/2010/1/zt02523p026.pdf
LA English
U1 0
U2 0
AB Penthicodes celebica n. sp., is described from Sulawesi, P. warleti n.
   sp. from India (Assam) and P. caja malayana n. ssp. from peninsular
   Malaysia. They are compared with the allied species of the subgenus
   Ereosoma Kirkaldy, 1906, as treated by Nagai & Porion (1996): P. astraea
   (Stal, 1864), P. atomaria (Weber, 1801) P. bimaculata (Schmidt, 1905),
   P. caja (Walker, 1851), P. pulchella (Guerin-Meneville, 1838), P.
   quadrimaculata Lallemand, 1963, P. rugulosa (Stal, 1870) and P.
   variegata (Guerin-Meneville, 1829). Penthicodes quadrimaculata is
   removed from synonymy with P. bimaculata. Male genitalia of all treated
   species are illustrated and described. New geographical records,
   distribution maps, behaviour data and photographs of habitus are given.
   An illustrated identification key to all 12 species of the genus,
   including P. farinosa and P. nicobarica, is proposed. Penthicodes
   basigera (Walker, 1870) is transferred to the genus Scamandra Stal, 1863
   and the new combination Scamandra basigera (Walker, 1870) n. comb. is
   proposed. The subgenus Ereosoma is regarded as heterogenous and the
   species are separated in 2 new species-groups on the base of the male
   genitalia and colour pattern: group astraea+ (astraea, bimaculata, caja,
   celebica, quadrimaculata, rugulosa and variegata) and group atomaria+
   (atomaria, pulchella, warleti).

   Department of Entomology, Vautier Street 29, B-1000 Brussels, Belgium,
   Belgium.

   China: identification and new species.

   Wei, Meicai (weimc@126.com)

LA English
U1 0
U2 0
AB A key to the species groups of Pachyprotasis from China is presented and
   the known species are associated with each of the groups. The species of
   the formosana group are reviewed and keyed. Four new species are
   described in this group, P. fopingensis sp. nov. (Shaanxi), P.
   maculoannulata sp. nov. (Hubei), P. nigricoxis sp. nov. (Yunnan) and P.
   altantennatasp. nov. (Hubei). The diagnostic characters of the
   previously known species of the group in China are revised.

TI A new fossil genus of Mesochrysopidae (Neuroptera) from the Early
   Cretaceous Yixian Formation of China.
AU Ren, Dong
   Makarkin, Vladimir N. (vnmakarkin@mail.ru) 
   Yang, Qiang
SO Zootaxa
VL 2523
PS 50-56
PD 30 Jun 2010
PY 2010
UR http://www.mapress.com/zootaxa/list/2010/2523.html
AW http://www.mapress.com/zootaxa/2010/1/zt02523p056.pdf
LA English
U1 0
U2 1
AB Longicellochrysa yixiana gen. et sp. nov. (Neuroptera: Mesochrysopidae)
   is described from the Mesozoic Yixian Formation (China). Allopteridae
   and Tachinymphidae of Nel et al. (2005) are considered subfamilies of
   Mesochrysopidae, along with Mesochrysopinae. Longicellochrysa gen. nov.
   displays a mixture of character states of Mesochrysopinae and
   Allopterinae and can not be assigned to any subfamily, indirectly
   supporting a family status of Mesochrysopidae sensu lato.
C1 Makarkin, Vladimir N.; College of Life Science, Capital Normal
   University, Beijing, 100048, China, China.
EM vnmakarkin@mail.ru

   Eurasia; Asia; China; Geological time periods; Mesozoic

   Longicellochrysa yixiana [Liaoning /  / new species] [Cretaceous /  / ].

DT Article
TI A review of burrower bugs (Hemiptera: Heteroptera: Cydnidae sensu lato)
   of Guam.
AU Lis, Jerzy A. (cydnus@uni.opole.pl) 
   Zack, Richard S.
SO Zootaxa
VL 2523
PS 57-64
PD 30 Jun 2010
PY 2010
UR http://www.mapress.com/zootaxa/list/2010/2523.html
AW http://www.mapress.com/zootaxa/2010/1/zt02523p064.pdf
LA English
U1 0
U2 1
AB Five species representing the family Cydnidae sensu lato are recorded
   from Guam; three of them are reported for the first time from the
   island: Byrsinus varians (Fabricius, 1803), Fromundus biimpressus
   (Horvath, 1919), and Rhytidoporus indentatus Uhler, 1877. The widespread
   species, Fromundus pygmaeus (Dallas), was recorded by Ruckes (1963) and
   verified by us. The occurrence of a fifth species, previously listed
   from the island by Ruckes (1963) and Lis (1996), namely Adrisa
   flavomarginata (Vollenhoven, 1868), is regarded as doubtful. Of four
   currently known burrower bug species occurring on Guam, three are
   Oriental and one is American in origin. A key to all burrower bug
   species known from the island is provided. Additionally, Microporus
   shiromai Froeschner, 1976 from Hawaii is regarded as a junior synonym of
   Byrsinus varians (Fabricius, 1803).
C1 Lis, Jerzy A.; Department of Biosystematics, University of Opole, Oleska
   22, 45-052, Opole, Poland, Poland.
EM cydnus@uni.opole.pl
RI Lis, Jerzy A./F-1172-2015
OI Lis, Jerzy A./0000-0003-1332-8331

SN 1175-5326; 1175-5334

PT J

DT Article
TI A revision of the genus Zatypota Forster of Japan, with descriptions of
   nine new species and notes on their hosts (Hymenoptera: Ichneumonidae:
   Pimplinae).
AU Matsumoto, Rikio (rikio@mus-nh.city.osaka.jp) 
   Takasuka, Keizo
SO Zootaxa
VL 2522
PS 1-43
PD 30 Jun 2010
PY 2010
UR http://www.mapress.com/zootaxa/list/2010/2522.html
AW http://www.mapress.com/zootaxa/2010/1/zt02522p043.pdf
LA English
U1 0
U2 0
AB Japanese species of the genus Zatypota are revised and a total of twelve
   species are recognized. Nine of them, Z. baragi sp. nov., Z. brachycera
   sp. nov., Z. chryssophaga sp. nov., Z. dendrobia sp. nov., Z. elegans
   sp. nov., Z. maculata sp. nov., Z. sulcata sp. nov., Z. takayu sp. nov.
   and Z. yambar sp. nov., are new to science and one, Z. percontatoria, is
   newly recorded from Japan. Host records are given for ten species
   including seven new and one newly recorded species based on reared
   materials. Each species utilizes different spider species as hosts. All
   host spiders belong to Theridiidae (nine species) and Linyphiidae (Z.
   sulcata). A key to Japanese species is provided and notes on their
   biology are given.
C1 Matsumoto, Rikio; Osaka Museum of Natural History, Nagai Park 1-23,
   Higashisumiyoshi-ku, Osaka, Japan, Japan.
EM rikio@mus-nh.city.osaka.jp
SC Parasitology; Zoology
SN 1175-5326; 1175-5334

   and disorders; Parasites; Insect parasites; Hosts; Land zones; Oriental
   region; Palaearctic region; Eurasia; Asia

AN ZOOR14609063831
DT Article
TI A polychromatic new species of Apiomerus (Hemiptera: Reduviidae:
   Harpactorinae) from Central America.
AU Forero, Dimitri (dimitri.forero@ucr.edu) 
   Berniker, Lily
   Szerlip, Sigurd
SO Zootaxa
VL 2522
PS 44-60
PD 30 Jun 2010
PY 2010
UR http://www.mapress.com/zootaxa/list/2010/2522.html
AW http://www.mapress.com/zootaxa/2010/1/zt02522p060.pdf
LA English
U1 0
U2 1
AB Apiomerus barrocoloradoi sp. nov. is described from Costa Rica and
   Panama. This new species is highly polychromatic, a judgment based on
   specimens of the same locality. Dorsal habitus images documenting the
   range of variation of the color pattern are provided. Male and female
   genitalia are documented in detail to provide unambiguous characters for
   species recognition. Color variation is discussed with regard to
   traditional species limits.
C1 Forero, Dimitri; Heteropteran Systematics Lab, Department of Entomology,
   University of California Riverside, Riverside CA 92521, USA, USA.

   Central America

TI A new, remarkable genus and two new species of Ectrichodiinae
   (Hemiptera: Heteroptera: Reduviidae) from Madagascar.
AU Chlond, Dominik (dominik.chlond@us.edu.pl) 
SO Zootaxa
VL 2522
PS 61-68
PD 30 Jun 2010
PY 2010
UR http://www.mapress.com/zootaxa/list/2010/2522.html
AW http://www.mapress.com/zootaxa/2010/1/zt02522p068.pdf
LA English
U1 0
U2 1
AB Gibbosella, a new remarkable genus, and two new species G. mirabilis and
   G. elongata are described based on specimens from Madagascar. The dorsal
   habitus as well as diagnostic characters of  the females' genitalia are
   illustrated with 13 figures. A key to the species is also provided.

DT Article
TI Two new species of the oribatid mite genus Phyllochthonius Trave, 1967
   (Acari: Oribatida: Phyllochthoniidae) from Thailand.
AU Fuangarworn, Marut (marut.f@chula.ac.th) 
SO Zootaxa
VL 2521
PS 26-36
PD 29 Jun 2010
PY 2010
UR http://www.mapress.com/zootaxa/list/2010/2521.html
AW http://www.mapress.com/zootaxa/2010/2/zt02521p036.pdf
LA English
U1 0
U2 0
AB The enarthronote oribatid mite genus Phyllochthonius Trave, 1967 (Acari:
   Oribatida: Phyllochthoniidae) is recorded from Thailand for the first
   time. Two new species, Phyllochthonius ovatosetosus n. sp. collected
   from sandy soil in a riparian habitat and Phyllochthonius peniculus n.
   sp. collected from leaf-litter on the forest floor, are described based
   on adults and all immature instars, and on only the adult specimen
   respectively. The genus is rediagnosed and a key to the three currently
   known species is provided.

   Chulalongkorn University, Bangkok, 10330, Thailand, Thailand.

AN ZOOR14609063716
DT Article
TI A new species of Hypsiboas Wagler (Anura: Hylidae) closely related to H.
   multifasciatus Guenther from southeastern Brazil.
AU Ribeiro De Carvalho, Thiago
   Giaretta, Ariovaldo Antonio (aagiaretta@gmail.com) 
   Facure, Katia Gomes
SO Zootaxa
VL 2521
PS 37-52
PD 29 Jun 2010
PY 2010
UR http://www.mapress.com/zootaxa/list/2010/2521.html
AW http://www.mapress.com/zootaxa/2010/2/zt02521p052.pdf
LA English
U1 0
U2 0
AB We describe a new species based on two populations, from the State of
   Minas Gerais, using advertisement call and morphological data as
   diagnostic characters. Hypsiboas paranaiba sp. n. is distinguished from
   the large-sized species of the group by the absence of a white stripe on
   upper (H. lanciformis) or upper and lower lips (H. leucocheilus); from
   H. albopunctatus by the absence of distinct light spots on outer thighs
   and inguinal region; and from H. multifasciatus by reaching a smaller
   maximum size and presenting a head as long as wide. The new species
   occurs in the Cerrado biome of southeastern Brazil in the State of Minas
   Gerais, and central Brazil in the State of Goias, whereas H.
   multifasciatus is restricted to the Amazon Forest domain, and possibly
   to forest domains in northeastern Brazil.
C1 Giaretta, Ariovaldo Antonio; Laboratorio de Taxonomia, Sistematica de
   Ecologia de Anuros Neotropicais, Universidade Federal de
   Uberlandia-Pontal, Ituiutaba, MG, 38302-000, Brazil, Brazil.
EM aagiaretta@gmail.com
SC Behavioral Sciences; Zoology
SN 1175-5326; 1175-5334
BD Systematics; Nomenclature; New taxa; Behaviour; Communication; Land
   zones; Neotropical region; South America
DE Hypsiboas multifasciatus [Acoustic signals / Advertisement call
   characteristics / ] [Brazil /  / ]. 
   Hypsiboas paranaiba [Brazil /  / New species]. 
TN Amphibians; Chordates; Vertebrates
ST Animalia, Chordata, Vertebrata, Amphibia, Lissamphibia, Anura, Hylidae
OR Hypsiboas multifasciatus (Hylidae). 
   Hypsiboas paranaiba - Carvalho & Giaretta 2010 (Hylidae): [Sp nov,
   Brazil, P. 38].

   from Iran.
AU Khanjani, Mohammad (mkhanjani@gmail.com) 
   Fayaz, Bahman Asali
   Ghanbalani, Gadir Nori
SO Zootaxa
VL 2521
PS 53-64
PD 29 Jun 2010
PY 2010
UR http://www.mapress.com/zootaxa/list/2010/2521.html
AW http://www.mapress.com/zootaxa/2010/2/zt02521p064.pdf
LA English
U1 0
U2 0
AB Two new species of the genus Neophyllobius Berlese, 1886 viz.
   Neophyllobius zolfigolii sp. nov. collected from soil under a wild rose
   bush and Neophyllobius kamalii sp. nov. collected from pomegranate
   leaves infested by Cenopalpus irani Dosse (Acari: Tenuipalpidae) are
   described and illustrated from Iran. A key to the Iranian species is
   provided.
